feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [froala/wysiwyg-editor] Froala Editor Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Froala Editor v4.0.1 to v4.1.1 was discovered to contain a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-41592
  • https://hacker.soarescorp.com/cve/2023-41592/
  • https://owasp.org/Top10/A03_2021-Injection/
  • https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/
  • https://github.com/froala/wysiwyg-editor/issues/4612#issuecomment-1729818089
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hvpq-7vcc-5hj5

entry.title: [in2code/femanager] TYPO3 extension femanager Broken Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
femanager fails to check access permissions for the invitation component. Depending on the configuration of the plugin, a remote user can create frontend user accounts with access to configured frontend groups.

References

  • https://github.com/in2code-de/femanager/commit/cc5f2893613a6b3fd2677c457574ab587a0862ca
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/in2code/femanager/CVE-2023-45023.yaml
  • https://github.com/in2code-de/femanager/releases/tag/7.2.2
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2023-008
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-93j4-v838-8767

entry.title: [drupal/core] Drupal core access bypass vulnerability
entry.content:
Under some circumstances, the Drupal core JSON:API module does not properly restrict access to certain content, which may result in unintended access bypass. Sites that do not have the JSON:API module enabled are not affected.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13677
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2021-010
  • https://github.com/drupal/core/commit/7a9bef4b4750d79ab42498e459012cabe4c4bd8b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3xr3-phjp-g6p2

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to modify catalog price rules to inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7938
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051916/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-23
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mgfr-44wv-hqv6

entry.title: [centreon/centreon] Centreon Sensitive Data Exposure
entry.content:
In Centreon Web through 2.8.29, disclosure of external components' passwords allows authenticated attackers to move laterally to external components.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17106
  • https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/10/08/1
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/issues/7098
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/9311
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rx4j-x3fh-9qwg

entry.title: [rainlab/blog-plugin] October CMS - RainLab Blog Plugin XSS
entry.content:
The RainLab Blog Plugin used in October CMS through 1.0.431 allows XSS by entering HTML on the Add Posts page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-7198
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/44144/
  • http://securitywarrior9.blogspot.com/2018/02/html-injection-october-cms.html
  • https://github.com/rainlab/blog-plugin/commit/6ae19a6e16ef3ba730692bc899851342c858bb94
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-96mh-7xpr-qcgw

entry.title: [october/october] October CMS File Upload Vulnerability
entry.content:
October CMS build 412 is vulnerable to Apache configuration modification via file upload functionality resulting in site compromise and possibly other applications on the server.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000194
  • https://github.com/octobercms/october/compare/v1.0.412...v1.0.413#diff-c328b7b99eac0d17b3c71eb37038fd61R224
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8vh6-8w76-v6m3

entry.title: [october/october] October CMS XSS
entry.content:
October CMS build 412 is vulnerable to stored XSS in brand logo image name resulting in JavaScript code execution in the victim's browser.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000193
  • https://github.com/octobercms/october/compare/v1.0.412...v1.0.413#diff-66d6dfe5e11488e1afefcb69b8bdaabfR31
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3p6c-9xhm-8x7h

entry.title: [october/october] October CMS CSRF
entry.content:
Cross-Site Request Forgery exists in OctoberCMS 1.0.426 (aka Build 426) due to improper validation of CSRF tokens for postback handling, allowing an attacker to successfully take over the victim's account. The attack bypasses a protection mechanism involving X-CSRF headers and CSRF tokens via a certain _handler postback variable.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16244
  • https://github.com/octobercms/october/commit/4a6e0e1e0e2c3facebc17e0db38c5b4d4cb05bd0
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/43106/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vm6r-4p4v-232x

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Generic in GitHub repository dolibarr/dolibarr prior to 18.0.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5323
  • https://github.com/dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/695ca086847b3b6a185afa93e897972c93c43d15
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/7a048bb7-bfdd-4299-931e-9bc283e92bc8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-39m3-cj8c-886r

entry.title: [wallabag/wallabag] Wallabag user can disable 2FA unintentionally
entry.content:
Impact

wallabag was discovered to contain a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) which allows attackers to arbitrarily disable 2FA through /config/otp/app/disable and /config/otp/email/disable.

This vulnerability has a CVSSv3.1 score of 4.3.

You should upgrade your instance to version 2.6.7 or higher.

Resolution

These endpoints now require POST method.

Credits

We would like to thank @dhina016 for reporting this issue through huntr.dev.

Reference: https://huntr.dev/bounties/4c446fe7-2a44-4907-b0cf-4ab77d75c487/

References

  • https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/security/advisories/GHSA-56fm-hfp3-x3w3
  • https://github.com/wallabag/wallabag/commit/0cfdddc2eb0aee5ffb69bf499d377d75655ba157
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/4c446fe7-2a44-4907-b0cf-4ab77d75c487/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-56fm-hfp3-x3w3

entry.content:

entry.title: [thorsten/phpmyfaq] phpMyFAQ allows unrestricted file types in image field
entry.content:

entry.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber uses hard coded credentials
entry.content:
Use of Hard-coded Credentials in GitHub repository microweber/microweber 1.3.4 and prior. A patch is available and anticipated to be part of version 2.0.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5318
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/commit/c48b34dfd6cae7a55b452280d692dc62512574b0
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/17826bdd-8136-48ae-afb9-af627cb6fd5d
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r657-3wqh-g2x9
